page.title: 19THE BAPTIST CHAPEL
page.content: We visited the Baptist Chapel at{ {Sutton-in-the-Elms}.It was built in 1650.The hexagonal part has been added to the original room.The Baptists used to meet secretly under the elm trees. The first pastor was Thomas Townsend from 1650-1699.There have been seventeen pastors to the present day. The Chapel was the first in Leicestershire and had stables to enable people to travel to the services.Before the Chapel had a baptistry people were baptised in the brook,the last person being Thomas Rainer in 1851.The Chapel has a pulpit,a manse and a graveyard.The oldest stone remaining is dated 1725. There is an organ and choir stalls.The Chapel has a valuable and rare clock. There is one like it in Windsor castle.
